headline: Show HN: Hacker News keyboard navigation [Chrome extension]
description:
Hacker News has a unique feature that reddit and other forums don't have - the "hide" button.

In theory, you may scan through the titles and click "hide" on each one you know you won't read. The benefit is when you come back later next time, you won't have to scan through those titles again.

This sounds great, except nobody does it, because it's too many clicks.

This chrome extension solves this with keyboard:

[↑] [↓]: go up and down the list

[←]: not interested / hide

[→]: open link (background new tab)

[Enter]: open link (foreground new tab)

[Space]: open comments

Github: https://github.com/ZYinMD/hacker-news-keyboard-navigation
headline_zh-Hans: Show HN: 黑客新闻的键盘导航[Chrome扩展]
headline_zh-Hant: Show HN: 黑客新聞的鍵盤導航[Chrome擴展]
description_zh-Hans:
Hacker News有一个reddit和其他论坛所没有的独特功能--"hide"按钮。

理论上，你可以扫描标题，并在每一个你知道你不会阅读的标题上点击"hide"。The benefit is when you come back later next time, you won't have to scan through those titles again.

This sounds great, except nobody does it, because it's too many clicks.

This chrome extension solves this with keyboard:

[↑] [↓]: go up and down the list

[←]: not interested / hide

[→]: open link (background new tab)

[Enter]: open link (foreground new tab)

[Space]: open comments

Github: https://github.com/ZYinMD/hacker-news-keyboard-navigation
description_zh-Hant:
Hacker News有一個reddit和其他論壇所沒有的獨特功能--"hide"按鈕。

理論上，你可以掃描標題，並在每一個你知道你不會閱讀的標題上點擊"hide"。The benefit is when you come back later next time, you won't have to scan through those titles again.

This sounds great, except nobody does it, because it's too many clicks.

This chrome extension solves this with keyboard:

[↑] [↓]: go up and down the list

[←]: not interested / hide

[→]: open link (background new tab)

[Enter]: open link (foreground new tab)

[Space]: open comments

Github: https://github.com/ZYinMD/hacker-news-keyboard-navigation
